meanings.definition: To stick or adhere something onto a surface using paste or glue.
meanings.sent1: She pasted the picture onto the wall.
meanings.sent2: I pasted the stamp onto the envelope.
meanings.sent3: The teacher pasted the star onto my homework for doing a great job.
meanings.sent4: His smile pasted on his face as he saw the surprise.
meanings.sent5: The glue pasted the pieces together perfectly.

meanings.definition: To strike or beat someone severely.
meanings.sent1: He pasted the bully back for picking on his friend.
meanings.sent2: The boxer pasted his opponent with a powerful punch.
meanings.sent3: The pillow fight escalated quickly, and soon they were pasting each other with pillows.
meanings.sent4: The storm pasted the coast with strong winds and heavy rain.
meanings.sent5: The chef pasted the dough to make it thin and even.

meanings.definition: To copy and paste text or images from one document to another.
meanings.sent1: She pasted the paragraph into her report from the website.
meanings.sent2: I pasted the image from the internet into my presentation.
meanings.sent3: The student pasted the wrong answer into his assignment by mistake.
meanings.sent4: The artist pasted different textures together to create a unique collage.
meanings.sent5: He pasted the code snippet into the program to fix the error.
